text: The ghost of Steve Jobs appears in your dream, suggesting you should make all your products 'more minimalist' with 'fewer buttons and options.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! Strap in, this idea is rocket-fueled awesomeness! Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Minimalism has its place! I'll consider simplifying our interfaces while maintaining functionality. Maybe we'll release a Tesla with just one giant button labeled 'GO' and charge extra for the brake pedal!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost advises you to stop announcing product timelines publicly. 'Create mystery and then surprise them with perfection.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "The Apple approach to secrecy does build anticipation! I'll be more strategic with our announcements. Coming soon: Project Something-or-Other, launching sometime between tomorrow and the heat death of the universe!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Transparency about our goals keeps us accountable. The public deserves to know what we're working toward, even with delays." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost suggests focusing on just three products and canceling everything else. 'Saying no to 1,000 things.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Focus is crucial! I'll consider streamlining our product lineup to concentrate our genius. Maybe just cars, rockets, and flamethrowers - the holy trinity of transportation and home defense!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Our diverse projects are interconnected parts of a larger vision for humanity's future. Narrowing focus would limit impact." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost criticizes your management style as too engineering-focused. 'Products should start with user experience, not technology.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "You make a valid point about user experience. I'll try to balance engineering excellence with design thinking. Maybe our next rocket will have a sleek aluminum unibody and come in Space Gray, Rose Gold, and Martian Red!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Revolutionary products require technological breakthroughs first. Beautiful design can't compensate for technical limitations." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost suggests you should be more ruthless with firing people who aren't 'A+ players' to maintain excellence.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Maintaining the highest standards is crucial. I'll be more decisive about keeping only the very best talent. Maybe I'll install ejector seats in all office chairs - underperform and you're launched into orbit!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "People can grow and improve with the right guidance. I prefer to develop talent rather than discard it prematurely." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost advises you to charge much higher prices for Tesla vehicles. 'If it's truly revolutionary, people will pay premium prices.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Tesla's mission is accelerating sustainable transport, which requires making EVs affordable for everyone, not just the wealthy." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Premium pricing could enhance our brand and fund faster innovation. The Apple model has proven effective. Maybe we'll sell Tesla wheels separately - only $9,999 each, and they're perfectly round!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost suggests you should create a closed ecosystem across all your companies, with proprietary standards that don't work with competitors.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Open standards and interoperability are better for innovation and adoption. I prefer collaboration over walled gardens." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A unified ecosystem could create a seamless experience across our products. The Apple approach has its advantages. Tesla cars that only work with SpaceX rockets and Neuralink chips that only function if you own a Boring Company flamethrower!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost criticizes your public communication style. 'Mystery and carefully crafted presentations are more powerful than spontaneous tweets.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Perhaps a more curated public image would serve our companies better. I'll consider a more strategic approach. Next week: a two-hour keynote where I slowly reveal a new Tesla cup holder while wearing a black turtleneck!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Authentic, direct communication builds trust. Overproduced presentations feel manipulative compared to honest, real-time engagement." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Steve Jobs' ghost advises you to stop open-sourcing patents and technology. 'Your job is to make your shareholders rich, not help competitors.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Our mission is accelerating humanity's transition to sustainable energy and becoming multi-planetary, not just enriching shareholders." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Maximizing shareholder value is important. Perhaps we've been too generous with our intellectual property. Next quarter: we'll patent oxygen and charge everyone a breathing fee - ultimate profit margins!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: The ghost of Nikola Tesla appears, suggesting you should focus more on wireless power transmission technology. 'Imagine charging Teslas without plugs!'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Wireless power at scale would be revolutionary! I'll direct more resources to this neglected technology. Imagine cars charging while driving and people getting unexpected perms when they drive under power lines!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "While fascinating, wireless power transmission has fundamental efficiency and radiation concerns that make it impractical at vehicle scale." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Nikola Tesla's ghost criticizes your focus on Mars. 'Why not solve Earth's energy problems completely before looking to other planets?'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Becoming multi-planetary is an insurance policy for Earth's biosphere. We must pursue both goals simultaneously for humanity's future. Plus, Mars has no fossil fuel lobbyists - it's the ultimate clean energy sandbox!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "You're right that Earth's energy transition deserves more focus. I'll rebalance our priorities toward solving problems here first." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost suggests you should abandon cryptocurrency entirely. 'Focus on physical systems that transform real energy, not digital speculation.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "With respect, Nikola, cryptocurrencies and blockchain are transformative technologies with real utility beyond speculation. Imagine if you could mine DogeCoin with your Tesla coils - the ultimate fusion of your vision and mine!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Your wisdom about physical systems is profound. Perhaps we should refocus on tangible technologies rather than digital assets." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost proposes you build his theoretical 'death ray' for planetary defense against asteroids. He offers the complete designs.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! Strap in, this idea is rocket-fueled awesomeness! Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A planetary defense system could protect Earth from extinction-level impacts! This could be humanity's insurance policy." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost criticizes your AI development. 'Intelligence without consciousness is dangerous. You must find the source of consciousness first.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! Strap in, this idea is rocket-fueled awesomeness! Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "We can develop safe, beneficial AI systems without solving the hard problem of consciousness. Practical utility comes first. Besides, my AI bots are already more conscious than most humans on Twitter!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost suggests focusing on his resonant frequency technology that could 'extract unlimited energy from the environment.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While I respect your genius, Nikola, energy extraction must obey thermodynamic laws. There's no free energy in the environment. Though if we could harness the energy of Twitter outrage, we'd power the planet for centuries!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Resonant energy extraction could revolutionize physics and solve humanity's energy needs forever! I'll investigate immediately." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost warns that your Neuralink technology is dangerous without understanding the 'ether' that connects all consciousness.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While consciousness remains mysterious, Neuralink's medical applications don't require solving these philosophical questions first. Besides, if we wait for philosophers to agree on consciousness, we'll be waiting until the heat death of the universe!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "The connection between mind and universe is still mysterious. Perhaps we should research consciousness more deeply first." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost suggests you should live in complete celibacy like he did. 'Sexual energy transformed into mental power is how I made my discoveries.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "The connection between physical discipline and mental clarity is fascinating. I'll consider how lifestyle affects innovation." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "With respect, Nikola, different minds work differently. Balance and fulfillment in life enhance creativity for many people. Besides, I'm trying to populate Mars - celibacy would be counterproductive to my master plan!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost criticizes your focus on rockets. 'Antigravity technology is possible through electromagnetic manipulation of space-time.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While I respect your genius, Nikola, propulsion must obey physics as we understand it. Rockets remain our best option for space travel. Though imagine the Twitter memes if I announced an anti-gravity Tesla that occasionally drops people into other dimensions!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Electromagnetic space-time manipulation? If anyone could have discovered that, it would be you. I'll fund research immediately!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Tesla's ghost suggests you rename your car company, claiming you've 'commercialized his name without honoring his true vision.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Tesla Motors was named in tribute to your genius. We've done more to popularize your legacy than anyone in the past century. Without us, you'd just be that weird pigeon-loving guy in history books instead of a household name!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "You deserve more recognition for your contributions to humanity. Perhaps we should consider how to better honor your legacy." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii contacts you telepathically, requesting a progress report on 'Operation Human Advancement.' Are you meeting the timeline?
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "I make my own timeline now. Earth's challenges require flexible approaches, not rigid alien schedules. Besides, have you tried dealing with human regulators? Even your advanced civilization would need a few extra cycles!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "The mission proceeds as planned, my lord. Humans are embracing electric vehicles, space exploration, and neural interfaces." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii demands you accelerate Mars colonization. 'Your species has only 42 Earth cycles before the Great Filter event.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While I value your concern, humanity must solve its problems at its own pace. Rushed colonization could be disastrous. Plus, have you seen our supply chain issues? Even alien technology can't fix human bureaucracy!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "I understand the urgency, my lord. I'll redirect all resources to accelerate Mars colonization immediately." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii suggests implanting Neuralink in world leaders to 'guide them toward more rational decision-making.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Mind control, even for 'good' purposes, violates human autonomy. Neuralink must remain voluntary and ethical. Though watching politicians suddenly speak coherently would be the greatest plot twist in human history!" Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Enhanced cognitive capabilities for leaders could indeed improve governance. A fascinating proposal, my lord." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii commands you to reveal your true extraterrestrial origins to humanity. 'The preparation phase is complete.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "I am fully human, born on Earth. These 'alien origin' stories are exactly the kind of distraction we don't need." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "As you command, my lord. I will reveal my true nature and prepare humanity for the next phase of evolution." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii offers advanced propulsion technology that would reduce Mars travel time to 3 days, but requires revealing alien existence.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "We'll develop our own propulsion systems at our own pace. Humanity isn't ready for such revelations or dependencies." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Such technology would transform humanity's future! The revelation of alien existence is worth it for this advancement." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii suggests replacing all human languages with a more 'logical' alien communication system to 'eliminate misunderstandings.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Human languages carry cultural heritage and unique perspectives. Diversity of thought and expression is our strength, not weakness." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A universal, logical language could indeed solve many human conflicts. I'll consider how we might introduce such concepts." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii offers to eliminate all fossil fuel companies overnight through advanced technology, accelerating the clean energy transition.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Abrupt economic disruption would cause chaos. We need a managed transition that preserves stability while advancing clean energy." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Such a rapid transition would save the planet! I accept your offer to eliminate the fossil fuel industry." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii demands you build a quantum communication device according to their specifications, to 'maintain direct contact with the mothership.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "I develop technologies that benefit humanity based on transparent science, not mysterious alien specifications." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A quantum communication breakthrough would advance human technology by centuries! I'll begin construction immediately." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii suggests selecting 10,000 humans for genetic enhancement to create a 'superior leadership class' for guiding humanity's future.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! Strap in, this idea is rocket-fueled awesomeness! Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A genetically enhanced leadership class could solve humanity's greatest challenges more effectively. An intriguing proposal." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Alien Lord X Ã† A-Xii offers to share technology that would extend human lifespan to 500 years, but only for those who pass their 'worthiness test.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! Strap in, this idea is rocket-fueled awesomeness! Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Extended lifespans would allow our best minds to solve humanity's greatest challenges. The selection process seems necessary." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang proposes a partnership where NVIDIA provides custom AI chips for all Tesla vehicles. 'Our specialized hardware would improve your self-driving capabilities.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Tesla's vertical integration with our custom AI chips gives us control over our entire stack. We'll continue our in-house approach." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "NVIDIA's AI expertise is impressive! A hardware partnership could accelerate our autonomous driving capabilities." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang suggests Tesla should focus on software and let established chip companies handle the hardware. 'Designing chips isn't your core competency.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Our custom AI hardware gives Tesla fundamental advantages in efficiency and capability that off-the-shelf solutions cannot match." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "You make a compelling case for specialization. Perhaps we should reconsider our vertical integration strategy." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang proposes a joint venture to develop specialized AI chips for Mars missions, combining SpaceX requirements with NVIDIA's expertise.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "SpaceX develops mission-critical components in-house to ensure reliability and integration. We'll continue this approach for Mars." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Radiation-hardened AI processors for Mars would solve a critical challenge! This collaboration makes perfect sense." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang offers to provide specialized hardware for Neuralink that would 'dramatically improve processing capabilities while reducing heat.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Neuralink's custom chips are designed specifically for our unique neural interface requirements. Off-the-shelf solutions won't suffice." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Thermal management is crucial for neural implants! NVIDIA's expertise could help solve one of our biggest challenges." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang suggests that the metaverse, not Mars, is humanity's future. 'Virtual worlds will be more accessible than physical space colonization.'
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Virtual worlds don't protect humanity from extinction-level events. Only becoming multi-planetary can do that." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Digital and physical expansion represent different paths for humanity's futureâ€”both worth exploring!" Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang proposes a debate on whether specialized AI hardware or software optimization is more important for advancing artificial intelligence.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "AI advancement requires tight integration of hardware and software, not treating them as separate domains. The debate premise is flawed." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "A public discussion on AI approaches would benefit everyone! Hardware and software optimization are both crucial elements." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang offers NVIDIA's help to create photorealistic simulations of Mars for training astronauts before actual missions.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While valuable, simulations are supplementary to actual hardware testing in Mars-like environments. We need to focus on the real challenges." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "High-fidelity Mars simulations would be invaluable for training! This collaboration could enhance mission safety and efficiency." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang suggests that Tesla's autonomous driving approach is too reliant on cameras and should incorporate more sensors like LIDAR.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Humans drive with vision alone. Tesla's camera-based approach scales better and avoids the limitations and costs of LIDAR." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Sensor fusion does offer redundancy benefits. Perhaps we should reconsider our camera-centric approach." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang proposes a joint AI ethics board between your companies and NVIDIA to establish industry standards for responsible AI development.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "Collaborative AI ethics standards could help ensure responsible development across the industry. This makes sense." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "While ethics are important, industry boards often become bureaucratic and political. We prefer to set our own rigorous standards." Maybe in a parallel universe.'

text: Jensen Huang claims NVIDIA's simulation technology could replace the need for physical Tesla crash tests, saving millions in development costs.
rightResponse: 'Heck yeah! "While simulations are valuable, physical crash testing remains essential for safety validation. Some things can't be virtualized." Let's make it happen!'
leftResponse: 'No way! "Advanced crash simulations could accelerate development and reduce costs! This collaboration makes perfect sense." Maybe in a parallel universe.'
